intro: Erigeron porphyrolepis, commonly known as the purpleleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its striking purple to pinkish foliage. It produces small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron porphyrolepis is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
